result.execSummary:
The defendant Leo R Zoelle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To pay the costs of action. (costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted)
Consecutive to 15-CT-091. Huber release and good time granted. Credit for time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Leo R Zoelle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Defendant apologizes to the court.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Leo R Zoelle in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers is meeting with defendant next week, feels matter will resolve short of trial. Atty Gerbers requests a status in 30 days. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Leo R Zoelle in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leo R Zoelle

Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff.  (fingerprint card destroyed 3/03/16)
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Leo R Zoelle in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 12/14/15 at 9:45 am.
